landing.title:
Hello,
I am Baptiste Dauphouy,
full-stack developer.

projects.title: Shopiette
projects.description: Quickly create e-commerce websites with Svelte.

projects.title: Vintify
projects.description: Easily import your Vinted products to Shopify.

projects.title: Vitaliplay
projects.description: Vitaliplay is a sports platform for seniors.

items.title: September 2018
items.text: Discovery of HTML and CSS in sophomore year of high school.
Creation of various projects, I explore, discover, and learn Javascript.

items.title: March 2020
items.text: Getting back into coding after a few months' break. Lockdown begins, and I need to do something productive with my days instead of playing Fortnite.

items.title: June 2020
items.text: I find my first client who is willing to pay me to develop his site: Flexomatic. In the end, he never paid me :(

items.title: May 2021
items.text: Creation of my first "serious" portfolio and purchase of my domain bdph.me (which I no longer own).

items.title: September 2021
items.text: I move from my countryside to Paris, prepare for my school start, and make the final adjustments to my portfolio.

items.title: November 2021
items.text: First freelance mission for a client who finally pays me! Synerg'hetic, an association at HETIC offering missions to its students, trusts me. The project: Vitaliplay, an online sports platform for seniors. I take care of the front-end and choose to use the React stack.

items.title: January 2022
items.text: Working for a client with a project to create a social network focused on users' professional skills, especially for developers and designers.

items.title: April 2022
items.text: Creation of a browser RPG as a group project for a school project. The result impresses the entire class.

items.title: August 2022
items.text: Start of my internship at Radio France.

contact.title: Contact
contact.subtitle: Did you like my presentation and want to work with me? Contact me by email or via my social networks.

footer.text: Made with Svelte and love by Baptiste Dauphouy.
